post_text: Chestnuts aren't the only things roasting this holiday season! üî•üéÑWatch as Devices & Services SVP Panos Panay uses Alexa+'s "Roast Me" feature to generate his festive out-of-office responses. Spoiler: AIexa doesn't hold back.

Another batch of Amazon Leo satellites deployed. Our seventh launch of the year is officially in the books. Huge thanks to United Launch Alliance (ULA) for taking our LA-04 payload to space aboard Atlas V. Amazon Leo is about one big goal: extending reliable, high-speed internet to those beyond the reach of existing networks. Really proud of this mission and what the team is building. Pumped for what‚Äôs ahead üöÄ

Starting today, Instagram for TV is rolling out first on Fire TV‚Äîmarking the first time Instagram content has been designed for television. What makes this launch special? ‚ú® Personalized channels organized by your interests‚Äîmusic, sports, travel, trending moments, and more ‚ú® Multi-account support (up to 5 accounts) so everyone in your household gets their own experience ‚ú® Search functionality to find creators, explore profiles, and discover new content ‚ú® Full engagement features‚Äîlike Reels, browse comments, and see reactions "Our mission is to get you to the world's best content fast, and we're thrilled to welcome Instagram to Fire TV," said Aidan Marcuss, VP of Fire TV. "We're committed to keep pushing the boundaries of entertainment on customers' biggest screens." The Instagram for TV app is available now in the U.S. on select Fire TV devices including Fire TV Stick HD, Fire TV Stick 4K Plus, Fire TV Stick 4K Max, and Fire TV Omni QLED Series.

Celebrating Belgian Entrepreneurial Success While Empowering Digital Growth Yesterday at our Blue Gate Delivery Station in Antwerp, we unveiled key insights from our 2025 SME Impact Report and a Female Digital Entrepreneurship Study commissioned by Becom and Amazon that highlight Belgian business resilience: ‚Ä¢ 90%+ of Belgian SMEs on Amazon export globally, generating ‚Ç¨380M+ in sales (2024) ‚Ä¢ ‚Ç¨85M+ in exports coming from rural areas, showing nationwide opportunity ‚Ä¢ 90% of Belgian female retail entrepreneurs feel fulfilled by their digital businesses ‚Ä¢ 73% report improved ability to balance work and family responsibilities through eCommerce Despite these successes, entrepreneurs face challenges: 25% struggle with supply chain complexities and 24% with regulatory compliance. The research shows 53% identify digital skills training as their most critical need for growth. That's why we've launched the E-Academy with Becom ‚Äì a comprehensive learning website with specialized courses and expert resources designed specifically to address these barriers. The event featured inspiring testimonials from THE MOCKTAIL CLUB , Solbio , and GreenPan, demonstrating how Belgian businesses are turning local creativity into global success. #DigitalEntrepreneurship #BelgianBusiness #WomenInBusiness #SMEsuccess

In this video, discover: ‚Ä¢ Key findings from our 2025 SME Impact Report presented by Eva Faict , Country Manager of Amazon in Belgium and The Netherlands ‚Ä¢ The launch of our E-Academy resource by Guillaume Codsi and Becom 's Managing Director Greet Dekocker ‚Ä¢ Inspiring testimonials from Belgian success stories THE MOCKTAIL CLUB, Solbio , and GreenPan ‚Ä¢ An exclusive tour of our state-of-the-art delivery station led by Nina Cerulis, Antwerp Delivery Station Manager From celebrating ‚Ç¨380M in Belgian SME export sales to witnessing how our logistics network supports local businesses, this event showcased the power of digital entrepreneurship in Belgium. Thank you to all participants who made this day memorable. We look forward to continuing our work with Belgian entrepreneurs. üöÄWatch the full video to feel the energy and inspiration from this special day! #AmazonBelgium #DigitalEntrepreneurship #BehindTheScenes #SMEsuccess

Months of preparation, collaboration, and dedication. And when it all comes together? Pure celebration. üï∫ From frontier agents to Nova Forge to Trainium3 UltraServers with 4.4x more performance and so much more, this year's #AWSreInvent was transformative. Thank you to every Amazon and Amazon Web Services (AWS) employee who made this conference unforgettable‚Äîfrom the engineers and product teams pushing the boundaries of innovation, to the event staff and behind-the-scenes heroes who brought it all together. Your dedication, expertise, and passion were on full display, and it showed in every moment. Thank you for making re:Invent 2025 extraordinary.

Can you tell which is AI and which is real? üîç At Amazon Web Services (AWS) re:Invent, our SVP of Devices & Services, Panos Panay, put his skills to the test in a game of "This or That"‚Äîtrying to spot the difference between real photos and AI-generated images created by Amazon Nova. Spoiler: It's harder than you think! We've unveiled major AI innovations at re:Invent that are transforming how we create, work, and imagine. Amazon Nova's image generation capabilities showcase just how far generative AI has come. See if you can spot the difference!

Join Amazon Web Services (AWS) CEO Matt Garman for an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at AWS re:Invent 2025, where tens of thousands of builders are experiencing the future of AI and cloud computing firsthand. From exploring the House of Kiro haunted house to creating custom scents at The Fragrance Lab and designing AI-powered stickers, re:Invent isn't just a conference. It's an immersive celebration of what's possible when innovation meets imagination. But the real excitement is in the announcements reshaping how organizations build and scale with AI: Amazon Nova: Next-generation foundation models delivering exceptional performance and value for enterprises worldwide. Amazon Bedrock AgentCore: Empowering developers to build the next wave of agentic AI applications with unprecedented flexibility and control. Three Frontier Agents from AWS: Revolutionary tools transforming how developers build, secure, and operate software at scale. AWS Trainium3: Now generally available, enabling faster, more affordable AI model training and deployment than ever before. Whether you're experiencing re:Invent in person or following along virtually, this is where the next generation of cloud innovation comes to life. Which innovation are you most excited about?

Amazon is investing up to $50 billion to advance U.S. government AI and supercomputing capabilities. üá∫üá∏ This historic commitment will deliver nearly 1.3 gigawatts of computing power to transform critical missions across national security, scientific research, and innovation. "Our investment in purpose-built government AI and cloud infrastructure will fundamentally transform how federal agencies leverage supercomputing,‚Äù said AWS CEO Matt Garman. ‚ÄúWe're giving agencies expanded access to advanced AI capabilities that will enable them to accelerate critical missions from cybersecurity to drug discovery. This investment removes the technology barriers that have held government back and further positions America to lead in the AI era.‚Äù

Forbes has recognized Amazon as #2 on both its Most Trusted Companies in America list and its Best Companies list‚Äîtwo prestigious rankings that reflect our commitment to customers, employees, and communities worldwide. üôå This week at our All Amazon Global Meeting, we're celebrating this recognition together. As our only company-wide event, this meeting brought together Amazon senior leadership‚Äîincluding Andy Jassy, Doug Herrington, Mike Hopkins, and others‚Äîwith teams from across the company to learn about Amazon's innovations and hear from leaders. While we're proud of this recognition, we know there's always more to do. These rankings motivate us to continue investing in our people, innovating on behalf of our customers, and contributing positively to the communities where we operate.

Excited to share new Amazon Leo Ultra is fastest satellite internet antenna ever built, delivering simultaneous download speeds up to 1 Gbps and upload speeds up to 400 Mbps, all powered by custom Leo silicon. Plus some more details on our network, which will offer enterprise-grade performance and advanced encryption, with secure private networking that bypasses public internet‚Äîconnecting directly to AWS and other cloud and on-premise networks. Combo will be extremely valuable for the millions of enterprises, government agencies, and organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity. Team is also kicking off our enterprise preview with select customers using production hardware and software to gather feedback and tailor solutions ahead of next year's commercial launch. Lots of encouraging progress to bring connectivity to customers and partners who need it most. https://lnkd.in/gZak7PF3

Pretty much every Amazon project starts with a code name. Echo was ‚ÄúDoppler,‚Äù our first Kindle was ‚ÄúFiona,‚Äù and our EC2 network device project was ‚ÄúBlackfoot,‚Äù after the penguins our AWS team saw while doing the work in Cape Town. For our satellite network, it was ‚ÄúProject Kuiper,‚Äù and today, we‚Äôre introducing the permanent name: Amazon Leo‚Äîfor the low Earth orbit (or LEO) constellation that powers the whole thing. Team‚Äôs made lots of progress (150+ satellites up, >1 Gbps speeds, customers signing on) and am excited for the difference Leo will make for the ~500 million households, and millions of enterprises, orgs, and governments who need it. https://lnkd.in/g6QgJwFQ

Amazon increases zero-tailpipe emission deliveries with a new fleet of e-cargo bikes in Antwerp Operating from our existing delivery station in Blue Gate, Amazon expands its zero-tailpipe emission e-cargo bike delivery network, following our successful launch in Brussels Pentagon area in 2022. "As we continue to decarbonize our operations, our close collaboration with local partners in Antwerp strengthens our cargo bike delivery capabilities in the city center," said Eva Faict, Country Manager for Amazon in Belgium & The Netherlands. "This aligns with our goal for more sustainable deliveries in Belgium, resulting in fewer tail-pipe emissions, less noise, and reduced traffic congestion, while providing fast and convenient deliveries for our customers." As the second Belgian city where Amazon packages are delivered with e-cargo bikes, Antwerp joins our growing network of European cities, including Berlin, Lyon, and Manchester, where we've successfully introduced e-cargo bike deliveries. This initiative strengthens our expanding network of over 60 micromobility hubs now operational in more than 45 European cities. #SustainableDelivery #LastMileInnovation #AmazonDelivers #Antwerp

Watch highlights from our Belgian Economic Mission event where Eva Faict, Country Manager for Amazon in Belgium and the Netherlands, was joined by Minister Simonet and Minister-President Diependaele to announce Amazon's ‚Ç¨1B investment in Belgium. Eva Faict highlighted our three key focus areas: "We will keep improving the customer experience, plug into Belgium's incredible talent base, and ensure Belgian SMEs can reach millions of new customers worldwide through Amazon." Minister Simonet emphasized how this investment reflects confidence in Belgium's capabilities: "It shows confidence from Amazon in Belgium's innovation, technology and talent... As Minister of SMEs, this is particularly good news for Belgian SMEs, who are at the heart of our economy." Minister-President Diependaele emphasized two crucial benefits: two crucial benefits for Flanders: "Amazon's technology helps Flanders' SMEs sell their products worldwide, and these investments reinforce our position as a magnet for innovation. We believe strongly in a knowledge-based economy, and it's a good sign when global companies recognize our region's innovative power." Proud to see our investment creating opportunities for Belgian businesses and talent! #AmazonBelgium #Innovation #BelgianEconomy #DigitalTransformation #SMEs

It's great to be back in New York. This week is particularly meaningful as I join world leaders and policymakers at the 80th United Nations General Assembly for critical discussions about the challenges and opportunities facing our global community. UNGA80 comes at a pivotal moment when technological innovation offers unprecedented potential to address some of humanity's most pressing issues. I'll be engaging with global leaders on how we can collectively harness new technologies and innovate for impact while addressing concerns about development and governance. I'm particularly excited to share our vision for how we are developing and deploying responsible AI, and helping to expand internet connectivity through Amazon Project Kuiper to improve lives, create economic opportunity, and build a more sustainable future. Read more about Amazon at UNGA here: https://lnkd.in/ghMtvXFx

If you've known me for some time, you know that I like a good company survey. They can be a periscope, rising us up out of our echo chambers to tell us what people really think. As the leader of Communications & Corporate Responsibility, I am particularly fond of the surveys that get at how people feel about the company broadly ‚Äì what we offer to consumers and businesses, but also our communities, the planet, partners (think SMBs) and our employees. Last year, Forbes introduced a new survey called ‚ÄúForbes Most Trusted Companies in America‚Äù that analyzes 1,500 companies across multiple factors, including employee satisfaction, consumer trust, financial performance, and public sentiment. In last year‚Äôs list, we didn't rank so our team made sure that Forbes saw Amazon as both a tech and retail company (they previously only viewed us as a retailer), and that they knew about all the good things we were doing for customers, employees, and our communities. Forbes came out with the new 2026 yesterday, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier and more proud to report that Amazon ranked #2 on Forbes' Most Trusted Companies in America. This recognition is the result of the work our teams do every day to live the CCR Vision, ensuring that our customers‚Äô lives, communities, and the planet are better because of Amazon, and that people know about it. Very grateful for all our teammates do every day to help the company earn this level of trust, which might be the most valuable asset we have as a company. Thank you for all that you do to help us earn and keep that trust. https://lnkd.in/e9Svw-tz

The moment we were waiting for üëè Every year, Amazon welcomes thousands of interns who think big and deliver results. Amazon and PLAY4PEACE team up to empower young Belgians with career workshops Amazon employees collaborate with Play4Peace in Molenbeek, Belgium to inspire and coach the next generation toward meaningful career opportunities. As part of our commitment to community engagement in Belgium, Amazon team members recently led an intensive career development workshop with Play4Peace, providing valuable insights on how to write resumes, increase profile prominence on LinkedIn, and prepare for interviews. Under the patronage of the Belgian King Philippe, Play4Peace is an organization for young people aged between 16 to 28, which serves as a stepping stone towards a promising professional future, developing their talent and potential through sports, education and mentoring. The Play4Peace House serves as a learning hub, welcoming students who seek a dedicated space for focused study without distractions. One of the session participants outlined her thanks ‚Äúfor organizing such a valuable session‚Äù. She stated that "as a young graduate, I found the resume and interview insights extremely helpful. I also truly appreciated the resume examples you shared. It will be a great reference as I refine my application materials". The benefits of these workshops extend well beyond the day of the event. Participants not only gain valuable skills but also build connections with Amazon mentors. Each edition brings together more young people, more Amazon volunteers, and most importantly, more human interactions, concrete feedback, and professional breakthroughs.

Education opens doors to economic independence and personal growth - a belief that drove our recent ‚ÄòEducation is Key‚Äô campaign in Luxembourg. From July to September, we focused on making a real difference in our local community by putting essential learning tools directly into the hands of those who need them most. Together with our trusted partners, Croix-Rouge Luxembourgeoise, St√´mm vun der Stross, and Digital Inclusion, we assembled and distributed 3,000 backpacks filled with everyday learning essentials - pencil cases, sharpeners, notepads, and coloured pencils - with Digital Inclusion receiving 1,000 of the backpacks to support their vital work in the community. Beyond the backpacks, we're particularly proud that 607 laptops found new homes through this initiative, giving even more people the chance to access the digital world and seize the opportunities available online. These resources are now making a difference in the lives of underserved children and adult learners across Luxembourg. It's through partnerships like these that we can create meaningful change in our community, one backpack, one laptop, one learner at a time. #EducationIsKey #CommunityImpact #Luxembourg
